description.narrative: The proposed project entails the acquisition, operation, maintenance and major electro-mechanical rehabilitation of the 404.2MW Vorotan cascade hydropower generation plants and associated reservoirs in southern Armenia (the Project), including the 76MW Spandaryan (commissioned in 1989), the 171MW Shamb (commissioned in 1979) and the 157.2MW Tatev (commissioned in 1970) plants along the Vorotan River (together, the Vorotan Cascade). The Vorotan Cascade is among the main power generation complexes in Armenia, providing both peak and base load generation, and performing grid stabilization services. The Vorotan Cascade is supported by a system of five reservoirs: Spandaryan, Angeghakot, Tolors, Shamb and a daily regulation reservoir. A newly created Armenian company, ContourGlobal Hydro Cascade CJSC (Company), which is wholly-owned by ContourGlobal, a global developer and operator of power generation projects, is acquiring the Vorotan Cascade assets from Vorotan Complex of Hydro Power Plants CJSC, an Armenian state-owned company.

The proposed project''s positive development impact includes: (i) transfer of state-owned hydros to a competent global private power company that will undertake a much-needed rehabilitation investment program, which is expected to improve the operational availability and efficiency of the power plants, helping prevent further degradation and reduction in power generation; (ii) the privatization proceeds will provide budgetary support to the Government of Armenia; (iii) positive climate change impacts through efficiency enhancements, often the least cost option for greenhouse gas abatement.
